paragraphs.text: To look back is not necessarily to be nostalgic.
paragraphs.ipa: /tuː lʊk bæk ɪz nɒt ˌnɛsɪˈsɛrɪli tuː biː nɒˈstældʒɪk/

paragraphs.text: When I come to Sandringham each year, I like to reflect on what Christmas must have been like, when King Edward VII, my great grandfather, and Queen Alexandra first came here as young parents.
paragraphs.ipa: /wɛn aɪ kʌm tuː ˈsændrɪŋəm iːtʃ jɪər, aɪ laɪk tuː rɪˈflɛkt ɒn wɒt ˈkrɪsməs mʌst hæv biːn laɪk, wɛn kɪŋ ˈɛdwəd ðə ˈsɛvənθ, maɪ ɡreɪt ˈɡrændˌfɑːðər, ænd kwiːn ˌælɪɡˈzɑːndrə fɜːst keɪm hɪər æz jʌŋ ˈpɛərənts/

paragraphs.text: I remember my own childhood Christmases here, with my father and mother and a great family gathering.
paragraphs.ipa: /aɪ rɪˈmɛmbər maɪ əʊn ˈtʃaɪldhʊd ˈkrɪsməsɪz hɪər, wɪð maɪ ˈfɑːðər ænd ˈmʌðər ænd ə ɡreɪt ˈfæmɪli ˈɡæðərɪŋ/

paragraphs.text: And now I delight in seeing my children and grandchildren enjoying the same traditions.
paragraphs.ipa: /ænd naʊ aɪ dɪˈlaɪt ɪn ˈsiːɪŋ maɪ ˈtʃɪldrən ænd ˈɡrænˌtʃɪldrən ɪnˈdʒɔɪɪŋ ðə seɪm trəˈdɪʃənz/

paragraphs.text: Christmas is the celebration of the birth of the founder of the Christian faith, an event which took place almost 2,000 years ago.
paragraphs.ipa: /ˈkrɪsməs ɪz ðə ˌsɛlɪˈbreɪʃən əv ðə bɜːθ əv ðə ˈfaʊndər əv ðə ˈkrɪstʃən feɪθ, ən ɪˈvɛnt wɪʧ tʊk pleɪs ˈɔːlməʊst ˈtuː ˈθaʊzənd jɪəz əˈɡəʊ/

paragraphs.text: Every year at this time, we are asked to look back at that extraordinary story and remind ourselves of the message which inspired Christ's followers then and which is just as relevant today.
paragraphs.ipa: /ˈɛvri jɪər æt ðɪs taɪm, wiː ɑːr ɑːskt tuː lʊk bæk æt ðæt ɪkˈstrɔːdnri ˈstɔːri ænd rɪˈmaɪnd aʊərˈsɛlvz əv ðə ˈmɛsɪʤ wɪʧ ɪnˈspaɪəd kraɪsts ˈfɒləʊəz ðɛn ænd wɪʧ ɪz ʤʌst æz ˈrɛlɪvənt təˈdeɪ/

analysis.purpose: Connect historical significance to the present

paragraphs.text: At Christmas, I enjoy looking back on some of the events of the year.
paragraphs.ipa: /æt ˈkrɪsməs, aɪ ɪnˈdʒɔɪ ˈlʊkɪŋ bæk ɒn sʌm əv ði ɪˈvɛnts əv ðə jɪər/

analysis.purpose: Transition to reflections on the past year

paragraphs.text: Many have their roots in history, but still have a real point for us today.
paragraphs.ipa: /ˈmɛni hæv ðeə ruːts ɪn ˈhɪstəri, bʌt stɪl hæv ə riːl pɔɪnt fər ʌs təˈdeɪ/

paragraphs.text: I recall especially a dazzling spring day in Norwich when I attended the Monde service, the cathedral providing a spectacular setting.
paragraphs.ipa: /aɪ rɪˈkɔːl ɪˈspɛʃəli ə ˈdæzlɪŋ sprɪŋ deɪ ɪn ˈnɒrɪʤ wɛn aɪ əˈtɛndɪd ðə mɒnd ˈsɜːvɪs, ðə kəˈθiːdrəl prəˈvaɪdɪŋ ə spɛkˈtækjʊlər ˈsɛtɪŋ/

paragraphs.text: The lovely service is always a reminder of Christ's words to His disciples.
paragraphs.ipa: /ðə ˈlʌvli ˈsɜːvɪs ɪz ˈɔːlweɪz ə rɪˈmaɪndər əv kraɪsts wɜːdz tuː hɪz dɪˈsaɪplz/

paragraphs.text: Love one another as I have loved you. It sounds so simple yet it proves so hard to obey.
paragraphs.ipa: /lʌv wʌn əˈnʌðər æz aɪ hæv lʌvd juː. ɪt saʊndz səʊ ˈsɪmpl jɛt ɪt pruːvz səʊ hɑːd tuː əˈbeɪ/

paragraphs.text: In June came troopsing the colour.
paragraphs.ipa: /ɪn ʤuːn keɪm ˈtruːpsɪŋ ðə ˈkʌlə/

paragraphs.text: A vivid reminder of this country's proud military tradition and of the discipline and dedication which our service men and women show in their taxing tasks of peacekeeping in many distant parts of the world.
paragraphs.ipa: /ə ˈvɪvɪd rɪˈmaɪndər əv ðɪs ˈkʌntriz praʊd ˈmɪlɪtəri trəˈdɪʃən ænd əv ðə ˈdɪsɪplɪn ænd ˌdɛdɪˈkeɪʃən wɪʧ ˈaʊə ˈsɜːvɪs mɛn ænd ˈwɪmɪn ʃəʊ ɪn ðeə ˈtæksɪŋ tɑːsks əv ˈpiːsˌkiːpɪŋ ɪn ˈmɛni ˈdɪstənt pɑːts əv ðə wɜːld/

paragraphs.text: Then in August, I opened Parliament.
paragraphs.ipa: /ðɛn ɪn ˈɔːɡəst, aɪ ˈəʊpənd ˈpɑːləmənt/

paragraphs.text: This is not just a state occasion, but is also symbolic of the process of parliamentary democracy, which we enjoy here in Britain and in so many countries of the Commonwealth.
paragraphs.ipa: /ðɪs ɪz nɒt ʤʌst ə steɪt əˈkeɪʒən, bʌt ɪz ˈɔːlsəʊ sɪmˈbɒlɪk əv ðə ˈprəʊsɛs əv ˌpɑːləˈmɛntəri dɪˈmɒkrəsi, wɪʧ wiː ɪnˈʤɔɪ hɪər ɪn ˈbrɪtən ænd ɪn səʊ ˈmɛni ˈkʌntriz əv ðə ˈkɒmənwelθ/

paragraphs.text: It is a process which seeks to express the ideal of the equality of all citizens under the law.
paragraphs.ipa: /ɪt ɪz ə ˈprəʊsɛs wɪʧ siːks tuː ɪksˈprɛs ði aɪˈdɪəl əv ði iːˈkwɒlɪti əv ɔːl ˈsɪtɪzənz ˈʌndə ðə lɔː/

paragraphs.text: So the past with its traditions has its lessons for us in 1996.
paragraphs.ipa: /səʊ ðə pɑːst wɪð ɪts trəˈdɪʃənz hæz ɪts ˈlɛsənz fər ʌs ɪn ˈnaɪntiːn ˈnaɪnti sɪks/

paragraphs.text: And in this year, in our travels, Prince Philippe and I have also been looking to the future.
paragraphs.ipa: /ænd ɪn ðɪs jɪər, ɪn ˈaʊə ˈtrævəlz, prɪns ˈfɪlɪp ænd aɪ hæv ˈɔːlsəʊ biːn ˈlʊkɪŋ tuː ðə ˈfjuːʧə/

paragraphs.text: I and all my family have always felt that one of our most important duties is to express in our visit services the goodwill of our country towards friends abroad near and far.
paragraphs.ipa: /aɪ ænd ɔːl maɪ ˈfæmɪli hæv ˈɔːlweɪz fɛlt ðæt wʌn əv ˈaʊə məʊst ɪmˈpɔːtənt ˈdjuːtiz ɪz tuː ɪksˈprɛs ɪn ˈaʊə ˈvɪzɪt ˈsɜːvɪsɪz ðə ɡʊdˈwɪl əv ˈaʊə ˈkʌntri təˈwɔːdz frɛndz əˈbrɔːd nɪər ænd fɑː/

paragraphs.text: So last spring we visited Poland and the Czech Republic, where we saw the development of democracy and prosperity in countries which only recently were communist governed.
paragraphs.ipa: /səʊ lɑːst sprɪŋ wiː ˈvɪzɪtɪd ˈpəʊlənd ænd ðə ʧɛk rɪˈpʌblɪk, wɛə wiː sɔː ðə dɪˈvɛləpmənt əv dɪˈmɒkrəsi ænd prɒˈspɛrɪti ɪn ˈkʌntriz wɪʧ ˈəʊnli ˈriːsntli wɜː ˈkɒmjʊnɪst ˈɡʌvənd/

paragraphs.text: And everywhere we received the best of welcomes.
paragraphs.ipa: /ænd ˈɛvrɪwɛə wiː rɪˈsiːvd ðə bɛst əv ˈwɛlkəmz/

paragraphs.text: In the autumn we went to Thailand, where we renewed old friendships and witnessed the blending of tradition with a dynamic commercial spirit.
paragraphs.ipa: /ɪn ði ˈɔːtəm wiː wɛnt tuː ˈtaɪlænd, wɛə wiː rɪˈnjuːd əʊld ˈfrɛndʃɪps ænd ˈwɪtnɪst ðə ˈblɛndɪŋ əv trəˈdɪʃən wɪð ə daɪˈnæmɪk kəˈmɜːʃəl ˈspɪrɪt/

paragraphs.text: There was also a happy visit to this country by the President of France.
paragraphs.ipa: /ðɛə wɒz ˈɔːlsəʊ ə ˈhæpi ˈvɪzɪt tuː ðɪs ˈkʌntri baɪ ðə ˈprɛzɪdənt əv frɑːns/

paragraphs.text: And I shall never forget the state visit to President Mandela.
paragraphs.ipa: /ænd aɪ ʃæl ˈnɛvə fəˈɡɛt ðə steɪt ˈvɪzɪt tuː ˈprɛzɪdənt mænˈdɛlə/

paragraphs.text: That most gracious of men has shown us all how to accept the facts of the past without bitterness.
paragraphs.ipa: /ðæt məʊst ˈɡreɪʃəs əv mɛn hæz ʃəʊn ʌs ɔːl haʊ tuː əkˈsɛpt ðə fækts əv ðə pɑːst wɪˈðaʊt ˈbɪtənɪs/

paragraphs.text: How to see new opportunities as more important than old disputes and how to look forward with courage and optimism.
paragraphs.ipa: /haʊ tuː siː njuː ˌɒpəˈtjuːnɪtiz æz mɔːr ɪmˈpɔːtənt ðæn əʊld dɪsˈpjuːts ænd haʊ tuː lʊk ˈfɔːwəd wɪð ˈkʌrɪʤ ænd ˈɒptɪmɪzəm/

paragraphs.text: His example is that continuing inspiration to the whole Commonwealth and to all those everywhere who work for peace and reconciliation.
paragraphs.ipa: /hɪz ɪɡˈzɑːmpl ɪz ðæt kənˈtɪnjuːɪŋ ˌɪnspəˈreɪʃən tuː ðə həʊl ˈkɒmənwelθ ænd tuː ɔːl ðəʊz ˈɛvrɪwɛə huː wɜːk fɔː piːs ænd ˌrɛkənsɪlɪˈeɪʃən/

paragraphs.text: Each year brings its share of difficulties for many families.
paragraphs.ipa: /iːʧ jɪər brɪŋz ɪts ʃeər əv ˈdɪfɪkəltiz fɔː ˈmɛni ˈfæmɪliz/

paragraphs.text: This year has I know been no exception and during it some have suffered bereavement of a tragic and shocking kind.
paragraphs.ipa: /ðɪs jɪər hæz aɪ nəʊ biːn nəʊ ɪkˈsɛpʃən ænd ˈdjʊərɪŋ ɪt sʌm hæv ˈsʌfəd bɪˈriːvmənt əv ə ˈtræʤɪk ænd ˈʃɒkɪŋ kaɪnd/

paragraphs.text: At such times it is tempting for all of us, especially those who suffer, to look back and say if only.
paragraphs.ipa: /æt sʌʧ taɪmz ɪt ɪz ˈtɛmptɪŋ fɔːr ɔːl əv ʌs, ɪˈspɛʃəli ðəʊz huː ˈsʌfə, tuː lʊk bæk ænd seɪ ɪf ˈəʊnli/

paragraphs.text: But to look back in that way is to look down a blind alley.
paragraphs.ipa: /bʌt tuː lʊk bæk ɪn ðæt weɪ ɪz tuː lʊk daʊn ə blaɪnd ˈæli/

paragraphs.text: Better to look forward and say if only.
paragraphs.ipa: /ˈbɛtə tuː lʊk ˈfɔːwəd ænd seɪ ɪf ˈəʊnli/

paragraphs.text: If only we can live up to the example of the child who was born at Christmas with a love that came to embrace the whole world.
paragraphs.ipa: /ɪf ˈəʊnli wiː kæn lɪv ʌp tuː ði ɪɡˈzɑːmpl əv ðə tʃaɪld huː wɒz bɔːn æt ˈkrɪsməs wɪð ə lʌv ðæt keɪm tuː ɪmˈbreɪs ðə həʊl wɜːld/

paragraphs.text: If only we can let him recapture for us that time when we face the future with childhood's unbounded faith.
paragraphs.ipa: /ɪf ˈəʊnli wiː kæn lɛt hɪm ˌriːˈkæpʧə fɔːr ʌs ðæt taɪm wɛn wiː feɪs ðə ˈfjuːʧə wɪð ˈtʃaɪldhʊdz ʌnˈbaʊndɪd feɪθ/

paragraphs.text: Armed with that faith, the new year with all its challenges and chances should hold no terrors for us and we should be able to embark upon it undaunted.
paragraphs.ipa: /ɑːmd wɪð ðæt feɪθ, ðə njuː jɪər wɪð ɔːl ɪts ˈʧælɪnʤɪz ænd ˈʧɑːnsɪz ʃʊd həʊld nəʊ ˈtɛrəz fɔːr ʌs ænd wiː ʃʊd biː ˈeɪbl tuː ɪmˈbɑːk əˈpɒn ɪt ʌnˈdɔːntɪd/

paragraphs.text: My family joins me in wishing each one of you a very happy Christmas.
paragraphs.ipa: /maɪ ˈfæmɪli ʤɔɪnz miː ɪn ˈwɪʃɪŋ iːʧ wʌn əv juː ə ˈvɛri ˈhæpi ˈkrɪsməs/

paragraphs.text: I pray for you, my beloved, for you to be happy and happy.
paragraphs.ipa: /aɪ preɪ fɔː juː, maɪ bɪˈlʌvd, fɔː juː tuː biː ˈhæpi ænd ˈhæpi/

paragraphs.text: I pray for you to be happy and happy.
paragraphs.ipa: /aɪ preɪ fɔː juː tuː biː ˈhæpi ænd ˈhæpi/

paragraphs.text: I pray for you to be happy and happy.
paragraphs.ipa: /aɪ preɪ fɔː juː tuː biː ˈhæpi ænd ˈhæpi/

paragraphs.text: I pray for you to be happy and happy.
paragraphs.ipa: /aɪ preɪ fɔː juː tuː biː ˈhæpi ænd ˈhæpi/
